sect1.title: Introduction

textobject.phrase: Screenshot of the System Monitor applet.

sect1.para:
To add &applet; to a panel right-click on the panel to open the Panel menu, then choose
Add to panel Utility System Monitor .

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: When you add &applet; to a panel for the first time, the applet displays the on-going state of the processor. Nothing more is to be done, as this applet is simply used for viewing the system's state. Placing the cursor over a monitored resource displays the percentage of the resource in use.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences from the popup menu.

textobject.phrase: Screenshot of the &applet; applet preferences popup menu.

sect1.para: The Preferences dialog contains the following options:

listitem.para: Select the desired monitor resource to be displayed. Processor displays the processor usage, Memory displays the amount of memory being used, Network displays the network activity on the system's network interface, and Swap File displays how much of the swap file is being used.
Use this option to vary the width of the applet as displayed on the panel. This value is measured in pixels.
Use this option to change how often the applet updates the monitored resources. This value is measured in milliseconds.

This allows for the customization of the colors displayed in the processor monitor. Select colors for User, System, and Nice processes, as well as the Idle color by clicking on the appropriate button.

This allows for the customization of the colors displayed in the memory monitor. Select colors for Other, Shared, and Buffer memory spaces, as well as the memory color by clicking on the appropriate button.

This allows for the customization of the colors displayed in the network monitor. Select colors for SLIP, PLIP, and Ethernet interfaces, as well as the Other color by clicking on the appropriate button.
This allows for the customization of the colors displayed in the swap file monitor. Select colors for Used, and Free swap space by clicking on the appropriate button.
